quest.name: The Trolley Problem
journal: Zhun Zun is eyeing you with curiosity.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Though Zhun Zun didn't mention the trolley before, he's like as not at least heard of the thing. If we remind him, he may recall something of use.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I hope you've had more luck than I...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Shall I take the glimmer in thine eye to mean that thou hast struck upon a promising lead?

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Oh, valued customers! Were the other Mord of help?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Of a fashion. They told us of a trolley that runs to Nabaath Areng, at least...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But am I correct in thinking that there was a reason you did not do so yourself, when first we asked?

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Mm, yes... The gate, you see. It is impassable.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Before, there was a hulking thing of stone─the Talos. It opened the gate, they say.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: But none operate such a thing now. I do not even know if it yet exists.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: I do not know, but... You should travel east to Mount Biran Mines! That is where the trolley controls stand.

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: I still see miners there from time to time. If anyone knows what happened to the Talos...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: ...It would be them! Thank you, you've been a great help!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We're off to Mount Biran, then. Let's hope that someone will be there to answer our questions.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What a sight...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, pardon me! It's only... It's a bit daunting, isn't it?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mayhap the pall of light is the root of this land's desolation. Or mayhap the fault lies with man and his insatiable greed...

dialogue.name: ZHUNZUN
dialogue.text: Watch for beasts in the Hills! I do not like to lose customers.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The scale of the track is impressive, I'll give them that. Now we only need follow it until we come to the mines.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: This lever can't have been designed for a person to operate...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: ...But by what means did they harness the necessary aether?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Bit of a mess, isn't it? But the mechanisms for dispatching the trolley are here, just as Zhun Zun said.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, anyone who might know how to use them is not. We might wait for Zhun Zun's mysterious miners to appear, or have a look around and see if we can deduce anything useful in their absence. I'm in favor of the latter.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Something near the entrance to the mines proper caught Urianger's eye. Meet us there if you find anything.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: As much as I wish we could count on someone conveniently appearing to explain all of this to us, I'm sure you're aware that we don't have the time to waste.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Flecks of rust adorn the rails, but they nevertheless appear sturdy enough to bear the trolley without issue.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The benches within suggest that this must have been a passenger car. Oddly enough, though it is clearly old, it appears to be well maintained.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The cup is slightly warm, and a fair amount of tea─steeped overlong, if the color is any indication─remains within.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. What hast thou discerned?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I see... Indeed, thine observations are consistent with mine own.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: But let us refrain from further discussion ere our comrades arrive...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ample evidence of recent maintenance, and lukewarm tea besides...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: The levers for switching tracks looked like they were in good condition, though I couldn't move them myself. No ordinary person could, I think...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: It is my belief that no person is meant to.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: This “Talos” beareth more than a passing resemblance to golems of the Source...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Nor doth it appear to be the sole example of its kind. The proliferation of Talos fragments, as well as the enormity of the mechanisms here, suggest a considerable number were once in operation.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Alas, this specimen and its fellows now lie lifeless and broken, and I know not how to repair them that they might facilitate our passage through the gate.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: And without the aid of the Talos, even if thou wert somehow able to unbar the trolley's path, we would still have no means of propelling it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We might not know how to repair the Talos, but someone must. Otherwise, why keep everything else in working order? Whoever is maintaining the cars and rails must know something that we don't.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Let's ask them what it is, shall we?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Forename, I do believe you'll find a person of some interest skulking in the shadows behind the warehouses on the northwestern side of the tracks.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While you two have a friendly chat, the rest of us will gently encourage those to the south to come out of hiding.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Defend yourselves as necessary, of course, but do try to keep everyone in one piece.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Off we go, then!

dialogue.name: UNSUREMAN03611
dialogue.text: Wicked white! Where did you come from?

dialogue.name: UNSUREMAN03611
dialogue.text: No, never mind that─you have no business here, of that I'm sure!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: <huff> What are you? Urgh...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I feel a bit bad for them...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: They elected to take up arms against us, though the outcome was plain from the first.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: We... We won't let you...<wheeze>

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: That smarts...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Good to hear.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: These two weren't much trouble either. Let's see what they have to say for themselves.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: Us? We're not the brigands come to...to take what isn't ours!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Do we honestly look like we'd need to steal─what, some rusted bits of iron? Don't be absurd. We're not here to rob you.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: A likely story. You look, well...

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: You don't look normal, that's for certain. You don't have any wares, so you're clearly not merchants. Travelers never pass this way. The only reason you would come all the way out here is to strip the machinery for parts.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Oh, Thaffe, I have an idea! What if, once upon a time...

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: A lovely lady of noble birth ventured forth in search of her lost love, joined by her two most loyal servants, sworn to follow her unto world's end. On their journey, they met a sorcerer, as ancient as time itself. Moved by the lady's devotion, he offered to be their guide, and they...

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: ...turned up here, somehow!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...I can only assume that you're being intentionally obtuse, but in the unlikely event that that's a serious conjecture─no. I suppose I am a bodyguard of a sort, but we have rather larger concerns than faerie tale romances.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Though I would fain hear more of this ageless sorcerer and his heroic deeds...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Gods grant me strength...

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Um, if I may─we're actually searching for a means by which to travel to Nabaath Areng. We were hoping that the trolley here might offer a solution.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I realize that we haven't gotten off to the best of starts, but if you know anything about how we might get it working again...

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: The trolley?

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: The trolley!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: You should have led with that! We're always keen to discuss the trolley!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: (-Jeryk-)We're both engineers-in-training, in fact. Jeryk and Thaffe, at your service.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: (-Thaffe-)Technically, I'm a miner, and he does repair work. But our true passion is the trolley.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: (-Jeryk-)We're working with a few other folks to get it up and running again.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: (-Jeryk-)And before you ask─yes, it's true that there's little in need of transport these days. But that's no reason to consign a miracle of mechanical innovation to dust. The mere sight of it traveling the track once again would make hearts soar, mark my words!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You'll hear no argument from us. What progress have you made thus far?

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: (-Jeryk-)Not as much as we'd like, truth be told.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Well, is there anything we could do to assist you? We could gather materials, or help put pieces together...

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: (-Thaffe-)It's a sight more complicated than that, I'm afraid. If you spoke with Magnus, you'd understand. He's the only one with full knowledge of the trolley's operation.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: (-Thaffe-)I suppose you could speak with him, if you like. We'll introduce you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Very well. Our options are limited, and if this Magnus can explain whatever is preventing the trolley from being restored, I'd like to hear it.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: (-Thaffe-)Right. It looks like you'll be following us back to Twine, then!
